line_1: O Life! how pleasant in thy morning,
line_2: Young Fancy's rays the hills adorning!

line_1: O Life! how pleasant in thy morning,
O Life! how pleasant in thy morning,
line_2: Like school-boys, at th' expected warning,

line_1: And I can't but believe that they pass all the morning
line_2: In learning to dance, and their heads thus adorning.

line_1: To start from short slumbers and look for the morning —
line_2: Yet close my dull eyes when I see it returning;

line_1: As cheers the sun an April morning.
Numerous as dew drops from the womb of morning.
line_2: Ten thousand glittering lamps the skies adorning,
Dull sleep, and a downy-bed scorning,
I'll do it — But I give You Warning:

line_1: But how to spend next tedious morning,
Like a cours'd Hare in a Morning,
line_2: I hate your doubling and turning,

line_1: I suppose you all saw in the paper this morning,
To come to our Lodgings betimes in the Morning▪
line_2: And the Doctor was pleas'd, tho' so short was the Warning,

line_1: Don't they go about buying fine Things all the Morning?
line_2: Do they spare for Expences themselves in adorning?

line_1: If I were hang'd i' th' Morning.
If I were hang'd i' th' Morning.
